markets.title: Will **Biden's vaccine mandate** be blocked by the courts on January 17, 2022?
markets.subtitle: On January 17?
markets.no_sub_title: Injunction not in effect On Jan 17, 2022
markets.expiration_value: In NFIB v. Sebelius, the Supreme Court ruled: "Applicants now seek emergency relief from this Court, arguing that OSHA’s mandate exceeds its statutory authority and is otherwise unlawful. Agreeing that applicants are likely to prevail, we grant their applications and stay the rule."
markets.rules_primary: If a judicial ruling is issued such that the Occupational Safety and Health Administration’s (OSHA) COVID-19 Vaccination and Testing Emergency Temporary Standard (ETS) is not in effect at 10:00 AM on January 17, 2022, then the market resolves to Yes.
markets.rules_secondary:
If OSHA withdraws the ETS by 10:00 AM on January 17, 2022, then the market also resolves to Yes. Else, the market would resolve to No.

As of November 30, 2021, should no further judicial action be taken, the market would resolve to Yes since the operative judicial ruling enjoins the government from enforcing the mandate.

The above is a summary of the terms and conditions. The complete legally binding terms and conditions can be found at VAXMAND in the Rulebook, including how to treat a partial strike down. VAXMAND in the Rulebook also contains examples that market participants may find useful. All market participants should read the complete rules before participating in the market.
